document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

subSubSection.paragraph:
Paranothrotes tenuicornis tenuicornis
sp. et subsp. nov.: Mistshenko 1951: 520.

Paranothrotes tenuicornis sordidus
subsp. nov : Mistshenko 1951: 520. syn. nov.

Nocaropsis iranicus
n. sp. :
Ramme 1951 : 289

Nocaropsis iranicus Ramme, 1951
:

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Type locality.
Iran , Elbrus Mts.
Holotype :
male ( ZIN ).

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. N. Iran : Tehran , Mazandaran provinces ( Fig. 842 ).

Remarks. Mistshenko (1951a) and Bey-Bienko & Mistshenko (1951) distinguished
P. tenuicornis sordidus
from the nominotypical subspecies by the female hind tibia with blue-black inner surface (red or reddish in P. t. tenucornis ) and the male hind femur with densely serrated dorsal margin (sparse in P. t. tenucornis ). The coloration of the hind tibia in male is variable from black to dark red (black in the holotype ), in female from red to blue (reddish in allotype ) or bluish-red. In the Tar population (Tar lake near to east of Tehran ) of Iran some females have bluish tibia, some others bluish proximal part turning to red apically and some with reddish without blue tibia. Besides some male paratypes of
P. t. tenuicornis
have hind femur with dense teeth on the dorsal margin like in the holotype of
P. t. sordidus
. Because of these variations
P. t. sordidus
is undoubtedly a synonym of the nominotypical subspecies.

As it is the case in many taxa described by Mistshenko (1951a) , Mistshenko (in Bey-Bienko & Mistshenko 1951 ) and Ramme (1951) this species was also described in the same year by Ramme with the name
Nocaropsis iranicus
has to be considered its synonym.

On the other hand this species is closely related to
P. demawendi Ramme. They
are sister species or maybe subspecies of the same species. I think a more detailed field study is needed to clarify this relationship according to their distribution.

Ramme labelled the holotype of
Nocaropsis iranicus
as “
Nocaropsis persica Rme
”, but he used the species name “
iranicus
” instead of “
persica
” in his publication ( Ramme, 1951: 289 ), however he listed the same species as “
Nocaropsis persicus
n. sp. ” on the page 279.

Özdikmen (2010) proposed a nomen novum,
Paranothrotes rammei
, for
Paranothrotes iranicus ( Ramme, 1951 )
, because of his assumption of its homonymy with “
Paranothrotes iranicus ( Ramme, 1939 )
”, but Ramme (1939) did not describe any pamphagid species namely “
iranicus
” or “
Tropidauchen iranicus
” in 1939. According to Özdikmen (2010) “ Shumakov (1963) [in Horae Soc. Entomol. Union. Sov. , 49: 54] transferred
Tropidauchen iranicus Ramme, 1939
to the genus
Paranothrotes Mistshenko, 1951
as the combination
Paranothrotes iranicus ( Ramme, 1939 )
”. However, Shumakov (1963) did not record any pamphagid taxon as “
Paranothrotes iranicus ( Ramme, 1939 )
” or “
Tropidauchen iranicus Ramme, 1939
”.

There is only one taxon with the name “
iranicus
” in the genus
Paranothrotes
described by Ramme in 1951 as
Nocaropsis iranicus Ramme, 1951
. The genus
Nocaropsis Ramme, 1951
was considered a synonym of
Paranothrotes Mistshenko, 1951
for the first time by Bey-Bienko (1957 : 1701). Then, Shumakov (1963: 54) reported
Paranothrotes iranicus ( Ramme, 1951 )
with the citation of Ramme (1951) . Although Özdikmen (2010) cited the papers of Ramme (1939 , 1951 ) and Shumakov (1963) he surprisingly proposed a homonym name after an imaginary taxon name “
Paranothrotes iranicus ( Ramme, 1939 )
”. On the other hand Werner (1939) described Tropidouchen
iranicum Werner, 1939
, which is synonymized with
Saxetania cultricolle
herein. But this species was never transfered to another genus until now and this species is definitely not a
Paranothrotes
. Because of this pointless taxonomic action the generated name
Paranothrotes rammei Özdikmen, 2010
is an unnecessary and invalid name ( ICZN , Article 54.2).
